result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Tuinstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Stalking - Result in Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Sentencing argument by DA Christenson, references the State's Sentencing Memorandum.

Court recess at 1:32 p.m.  
Court reconvenes at 1:50 p.m.  Same appearances.

Statement by Atty Gary Freyberg.  DA continues with sentencing argument.  Court questions defense in regards to restitution amount requested by DA.  Statement by Atty Privat - will be requesting additional information and will be requesting a restitution hearing.  Court orders a restitution hearing be held within 60 days after sentencing.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court recess at 2:06 p.m.  
Court reconvenes at 2:27 p.m.  Same appearances.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 - Life imprisonment with no release and consecutive to each other and any other sentence.

COUNT 2 - Life imprisonment with no release and consecutive to each other and any other sentence.

CONDITIONS (ALL COUNTS):

-Court costs.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-No Contact with either of the victims families.
-DNA sample.
-Defendant is to comply with Statute 949.165.
-Defendant is not to possess any body armour, defendant is not to possess any firearms and defendant is not to vote in any elections until his civil rights have been restored.
-Restitution - to be set for restitution hearing within 60 days.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from September 30, 2014 to today.

COUNT 3 - 4 years of Initial Confinement and 4 years of Extended Supervison- CONCURRENT to the other sentences.  Sentence is to commence immediately.  CONDITIONS - above.

Sentences are to commence immediately.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Sheriff's Dept,

Court adjourned at 2:43 p.m.
